pros: It is a reliable job. Job security. Always get 40 plus hours in a week. Always have a chance to get overtime. Every other weekend off. Hiring process fairly easy. It is a job and it helps pays my bills. Great insurance. CNA program is offered. It is paid by the state if you stay on for a year. There are some more opportunities when it comes to continuing education but I don't know them all.
cons: This job consists of working long hours. Staff that you work with can help make it more bearable to work or dread going to work. This job is better working as a team. But there are a fair share of lazy people who make it harder on everyone else. Between long hours and rotating schedule it feels like you have no life.

review_title: Social Services at Northeast Florida State Hospital
pros: The surroundings are peaceful and rural.  The campus was built in the 1960s and resembles a small college campus.
cons:
There is constant turnover in the social services department.  The social workers have a heavy and stressful assignment which can scarcely be done in a 40 hour work week. 
The salaries are low and the expectations are high.  
The individuals served are seriously mentally ill and receive psychotropic medications for the most part.  There is little individual treatment, and group treatment is conducted four days a week in two 45-minute sessions.  The social workers are expected to provide much of this in addition to conducting ward government meetings weekly and to follow approximately 50 individuals, meeting their perceived and actual social needs.  There are required morning meetings daily and special meetings when a person is in crisis as well as treatment team meetings which each social worker attends six per month.
I was informed that the social workers have not had a raise in about ten years.

pros: Positive residents that truly want and need help. Residents provide positive comments regularly allowing employees to feel some appreciation for their work. Small amount of dedicated and caring staff.
cons: Very poor leadership. Services are money driven to ensure funding stays constant from the State. No support from management. Very low pay. Very unrealistic expectations. Little to no focus on employee appreciation or work/family life balance. Employees are strictly held accountable for attendance and tardiness, but no accountability for poor services provided to residents. Leadership consistently overlooks poor services provided by staff due to lack of monitoring and disregard from leadership. Leadership is satisfied with poor quality services provided as long as the paperwork shows services are completed according to State's requirements of documentation for steady flow of funding.

job_title: Human Services Worker in Macclenny, FL
pros: The individuals served are the only great positive thing about this employer.  These adults are there because they are mentally ill, and they need people who care.
cons: 99% of the staff that work here are there for the paycheck and benefits.  They feel if you start to "care" about the individuals, that you will be weak and they will take advantage of you.
